Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body and an unpierced lug at the left side. The wide filling-hole is surrounded by a double moulding, edged by a band of closely-spaced raised points. The outer edge of the shoulder is decorated with a band of raised points within a double moulding. The tapering round-tipped nozzle is broken at the tip; its flat top has raised edges which terminate in volutes on the shoulder, and a raised rim surrounds the wick-hole. On top of the nozzle is Eros standing with his right arm half-raised. The raised base is concave within, and at its centre is an impressed ring-and-dot pattern. The upper surface is covered with a dark brown slip, with runs below.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q591.bis)
